quizSrc.term: Which of the following is NOT an option for specifying a color in CSS3? | binary | color name | hexadecimal | rgb | rgba
Which of the following is NOT an option for specifying a color in CSS3? | All of these options are valid.
quizSrc.definition: All of these options are valid.

quizSrc.term: If your body tag uses the style attribute style="text-align:center", you can overwrite that property by using the CSS3 rule:body{ text-align: left; } | True | False

What is wrong with the following code?12345body{color:#000000;background-color:#FFFFFFfont-family:Times,Arial,Cursive;}Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M. | There is a missing semicolon | You can't style three properties in a single rule | This is a valid rule

What is wrong with the following code?Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. View this editor's accessibility help for more information. | There is a missing semicolon | You can't style three properties in a single rule | This is a valid rule

Assume the following rule is the only one that styles the body element:123body{font-family:Cursive,Helvetica,Verdana;}Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M.What happens if the browser doesn't support any of these font families? | The text will be displayed in Cursive | The text will not be displayed | The text will be displayed in the default browser font-family
quizSrc.definition: The text will be displayed in the default browser font-family

quizSrc.term: The browser defaults override rules specified in an external stylesheet. | True | False

Using the code below, will the body of the page have the background-color defined in the file style.css or the background color defined in the <style> tag?12345678910<head><metacharset="UTF-8"><title>Testcode</title><linkrel"stylesheet"href="style.css"><style>body{background-color:#44CCDD;}</style></head>Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M. | <style> | style.css
Internal styling (rules specified in the <head> section) override rules specified with the style attribute in a tag. | True | False
The default display value for the <a> element is: | inline-block | block | none | inline
The default display value for <span> is: | block | none | inline-block | inline
A block element takes up the full width of its parent, even if the content is smaller than the parent. So two block elements at the same time will not be side-by-side. | True | False
Inline elements take up the full width of the browser, even if the content is smaller than the browser size. | True | False
Which CSS3 property is used to center text? (We are only asking about the property name; not the value.) | A: center | align | text-align | text-center

Which of the following is the best way to convey that your text has special meaning? | Using colors to signify the important text | Using a combination of font size and color to signify the important text | Using semantic tags in addition to color and/or font. | Using a larger font size to signify the important text
quizSrc.definition: Using semantic tags in addition to color and/or font.

quizSrc.term: What is the correct HTML for referring to an external style sheet? | <link rel="stylesheet" url="mystyle.css"> | <link rel="stylesheet" href="mystyle.css"> | <link rel="stylesheet" src="mystyle.css"> | <style src="mystyle.css"></style>

What is the correct HTML for referring to an external style sheet stored in a subfolder called css? | <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/mystyle.css"> | <link rel="css/stylesheet" href="css/mystyle.css"> | <style src="css/mystyle.css"> | <link rel="css/stylesheet" href="mystyle.css">
The link to the external style sheet should be in the: | Meta-data - <head> | Displayable content - <body> | Document type
Using an external stylesheet allows you to update the style of many pages with only a few lines of code. | True | False
When creating a CSS rule you need to specify the selector, property, and _______. |
You can use the Inspect Element tool in your browser to see your CSS rules. | True | False
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. This is because the webpage style can come from many different sources. | True | False

What is wrong with the following rule?Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. View this editor's accessibility help for more information. | You can't specify three styles in a single rule | You can't specify three options for font-family. | Nothing - This is a valid rule
quizSrc.definition: Nothing - This is a valid rule

quizSrc.term: Assume the following rule is the only one that styles the body element:Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. View this editor's accessibility help for more information.What happens if the browser doesn't support Cursive or Helvetica? | The text will be displayed in Verdana | The text will not be displayed | The text will be displayed in Cursive.
quizSrc.definition: The text will be displayed in Verdana

quizSrc.term: Using the code below, will the body of the page have the background-color defined in the file style.css or the background color defined in the <style> tag?Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. View this editor's accessibility help for more information. | <style> | style.css
The default display value for paragraphs is: | inline | inline-block | block | none
Which CSS3 property is used to center text? (Provide only the property, not the value!) |
When creating a CSS rule you need to specify the _______, property, and value. |

What is wrong with the following rule?12345body{color:#000000;background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:Times,Arial,Cursive;}Information: Pressing Tab in the current editor will insert the tab character. Toggle this behavior by pressing Control+M. | You can't specify three styles in a single rule | You can't specify three options for font-family. | Nothing - This is a valid rule
quizSrc.definition: Nothing - This is a valid rule

quizSrc.term: The style tag and the style attribute are interchangeable -- this means that you accomplish the same effect with both. | True | False
Using the style attribute allows you to style many pages with only a few lines of code. | True | False
When creating a CSS rule you need to specify the selector, _______, and value. |
